Uninstall everything java related that you can from Synaptic.
What's the error you get with Synaptic.

Basically, our goal is to get the stuff that's already been installed purged so we can try and start fresh. Here's a hint for future reference. If your comfortable with the terminal, apt-get is your friend. Synaptic is not always so much your friend :P

Okay, now, make this easier on yourself and use the terminal to begin with. Use sudo apt-get install sun-java6-plugin. For flash, we need to make sure the multiverse repo is enabled and then sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree.
Installing java will ask you to accept the license agreement. Don't forget to use tab to move around when that happens.
Okay, so then let's turn our attention to Firefox.
In the terminal, do sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree.
Okay, so check about:plugins in Firefox. If you have Gnash or other flash alternatives in there, they need to die.

Yes, then do the opposite, sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree. If that still doesn't work, purge it again and you can try downloading the deb installer from adobe's site.
